title: Is it difficult to learn Arabic? How much time does it take to learn it up to B1 level? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s not that hard to learn, I know that Arabic is surrounded by myths like: The script is impossibly difficult, like hieroglyphics. Arabic has too many exotic sounds, impossible to learn for foreigners. Arabic has too many exotic sounds, impossible to learn for foreigners. Arabic grammar is impossibly complicated. …. but: Alphabet: Arabic only has an alphabet of 28 letters. They are all joined up, [pretty cool ;)] Pronunciation: Easy, you will get used to it very very quickly. Arabic is written phonetically, so every word is spelled exactly as it sounds. Conjugation: Arabic has nothing of the irregular verbs. The verb conjugation table is bigger than English (with singular, dual, plural, masculine and feminine categories), but once you’ve learned the table for one verb, you’re done. *Arabic verb system is quite easy. For example, there are just two tenses – past and non-past. for more: Why Arabic is not as hard as you think

I don’t think it’s difficult, but it does take time and effort. Arabic grammar isn’t particularly complex or hard to master. The biggest things for English speakers are: (1) Arabic has a different alphabet. While the alphabet isn’t hard to learn, it does take time to be able to recognize words instinctively without having to sound them out and (2) Arabic shares very few cognates with English. This means that every word you learn is a new word and can’t be figured instinctively because it looks or sounds like a similar English word. These are not obstacles that cannot be overcome but they do make Arabic slightly harder than it would be based on just grammar alone.
